ratings.comment: Brilliant Teacher, and my favourite.  Made things so easy to understand, very very interesting and fun.  Same with everyone else on the homework comment - way too much!!!!  But very useful.
Arun makes learning maths fun, but the homework is far too much.
Really entertaining. One of my favourite lecturers.

horrible!!!!! who teaches calculus without a book? No reference to follow if you have questions(and I had a crappy T.A. as well).  100 plus homework problems each week...if you have any doubts about calculus choose another lecturer.  By far the worst class I had at Madison -

This man is god. I had him as a freshman for 221 and despite the large amount of work and hours put into the course, if you survive this class, you are set for any other math class at Madison and will sail through it. Also, don't invest in a textbook for 221 because he never uses it-all homework is made up by him and on his website to be printed of
best teacher i have ever had, although tons tons of homework, it worths!

Prof Ram is a genius when it comes to mathematics; straight from MIT; born and raised an Indian.  The only problem is that he does not know how to teach!  That is the problem with  professors that know a little too much in their subjects of interest that they totally miss the whole teaching aspect.

THE GOOD NEWS: He explains everything thoroughly, in a way that is easy to understand. I definitely learned a lot. THE BAD NEWS: TONS of homework. Lots of late nights. Even when homeworks were started ahead of time

Ram rocks. You'll go to bed thinking of function creatures eating numbers and derivatives chomping on functions. "the derivative of e to the junk is e to the junk times the derivative of the junk." classic. tough class, but he MAKES you understand calculus

Ram rocks. You'll go to bed thinking of function creatures eating numbers and derivatives chomping on functions. "the derivative of e to the junk is e to the junk times the derivative of the junk." classic. tough class, but he MAKES you understand calculus
he's the man.  booyea

Professor Ram is by far my favorite professor so far, and I only had him last semester. The man is a genius and he's pretty much figured out a genius way of teaching Calculus to people who don't know.  If you wanna learn a lot, take Ram. If you had Calc  in HS don't, because you'll just complain and moan about it, cuz you'll think you know it all.

Great professor!  He explains everything thoroughly, and is really enthusiastic.  Lecture was actually interesting at times because he's very personable.  You will get an insane amount of HW.  Go to lecture and office hours, he will do a lot of them there.  Don't save it all for Sunday either, or you'll be up all night, but it's doable.

You know what, life is hard.  Ram's class is inspiring and difficult but in fact, having Ram as a freshman might be a good thing.  Ram shows u what other professors don't about calculus, and the amount of work you have to put into the class will program you to be a calc machine. take advance of the help at office hours, your ta, ect.  It's worth it

Lots of homework, but you really don't have to do it all. Each assignment is worth about a half percent of a grade, making homework worth only 8% total. He offers office hours on sundays, which are a must. Be prepared to spend about 10 hours a week.  I didn't take calc before, went to every office hour, only did hw on sunday and im getting a B.

Assigned way too much homework. And the tests were problems randomly selected from homework. Did not like that at all. Didn't seem to test greatly on concepts, just if you could do the really hard problems. Nice guy, but class is a lot of work.
I don't like the fact that he gives 100 problems of homework every week.  It's not easy to complete this since you don't learn all the material until friday.  His tests are not that hard though.

The homework sucks, every sunday i wake up and do his homework until i go to bed. But if you do it, the tests won't be a problem. Office hours help a lot. If possible, take wilson for 221. Once you come out of this class, you will underestand calculus though.

An amazing class for those who are willing to work and not cry about it.  Ram demands alot but u get alot back. I enjoyed lecture a lot, his stories were funny, and he actually care about talking to us. My advice is to do most of the 100 problems a week and go to office hours.  it means a lot of effort but it will be worth it come test time.

Has a way of teaching that makes you UNDERSTAND calculus.. I got a C+ in AP Calc in high school--on my first college exam with Ram I got an A. Unbelievable! Lots of homework but the test is 10 randomly chosen homework problems so the homework is TOTALLY worth it.

He is an amazing professor. He is absolutely brilliant but he brings the math down to your level by explaining it in really funny ways. I am not particularly good at math but I still did relatively well in the class. One tip for everyone, do the homework even though he expects at least 15 hours a week. Some weeks more!

He is really straight-forward. You get 100 problems a week for homework, but it's really helpful. Also, the mid-terms are just problems from the homework so if you know how to do the homework, you can easily get an A on the mid-terms.
Crazy amount of homework!
I can never understand how he goes from one step to the next.  He doesn't explain it.  He just assumes we know it.
Lots of homework but a very well taught class
He is funny and has many good stories to tell. He is also very creative in explaining concepts by comparing them to easy to understand objects or stories.
STAY AWAY.  HORRIBLE CLASS AND PROF.

Class is very difficult, but he's an awesome prof. very willing to help, is straightforward and clear in lecture, all test ?'s come from HW not that you'll remember but at least it's not crazy.  His office hours are very helpful and you will know calc backwards and forwards when you're done.  Don't worry, a 34 was a B on an exam :)

Extremely well thought out lectures.  Teaches the class from the ground level, which may feel patronizing to some, but is very effective.  LOTS AND LOTS of homework, but if you can soldier through that, you're golden.

This professor will make Calculus interesting for you, so if you perform well in class based on interest take this class. It is a relatively hard, and you will find working without a book actually kind of liberating after a while, but be prepared to work.

This was THE WORST professor I EVER HAD in 4 years at UW-Madison.   There are easier ways to get through Calculus and I suggest you find them.  College isn't only about challenging yourself - YOU WILL STRUGGLE IN HIS CLASS!
His homework is killer and the tests are really hard but lecture was great.  He doesn't use a book, which was frustrating at times, but he does post some lecture notes online.
Very clear and organized in explanations. Makes complex concepts easy to understand. HW is impossible to finish. Perfect class for the overachiever.

This class is hard..especially when hwk is ur life..wish he could atleast lessen the hwk to 50 a week...best math teacher i ever had..you'll glide through math 222 for sure if you atleast get AB in his class..
No Comments

Hated the class while I was taking it, so much work and it was pretty much impossible to finish exams (curves helped a lot though).  I can appereciate it now though...he was good at explaining things and made the material pretty clear.

Dearest Prof. Ram: You are so effing hott!  If I had to pick a prof. to have a crush on it would be you.  Please do something about your homework load though, it consumed my life.  I guess i am flying through calc 222, but i want my life back.  AMAZING lectures and totally worth taking. I heart Ram!

Professor Ram held hw study help every Sunday and they are more useful than any other part of this course. The hw might be long, but honestly I am gliding through 222 which is the most failed class in Wisconsin, most likely due to Ram's hw. He is also one of the most clear lecturers I've ever had.

If you are taking any other hard classes I would not recommend Ram as a calculus professor because homework WILL BE YOUR LIFE in this class.  However, he makes the material interesting.  The exams are impossible to complete, but partial credit and the curve will save you every time.

Ram is a really good professor.  Yeah, there is a killer amount of homework, but the tests are straight from the homework and it only counts as 10% anyway.  Plus, he devotes 3 hours of his weekend to work w/ people on problems.

probably a good professor if you can get past the hw - he seriously expects you to devote ~25 hrs/wk to this class - i personally didn't like the way he taught calculus, because i understand it the NORMAL way, e.g. straight from the book
Run away from this man. If his 100+ homework problems doesn't kill you his lame question and answer period will.

STAY AWAY!!!!  DO NOT TAKE PROF. RAM IF AT ALL POSSIBLE.  He is a really nice guy but even if you are great in math you will STRUGGLE in this class.  Homework is outrageous and ridiculous.   Ram himself couldn't even figure out certain problems in office hours.

Wow...I don't know how to start.  Hmm, let's see, if you are good at math, you'll probably be fine, if you need to go a bit more in depth to understand math, STAY AWAY or else get a tutor, EARLY.  I'm sorry, I'm not mathmatically inclined, so maybe I missed something that everyone else hasn't..?

So much homework you will freak out.  You will be pissed about the amount of homework.  You get about 100 problems a week and they only grade 5.  One nice thing is that the exam problems come from the homework so in theory if you do the homework you will be able to do well on the exams.

A really amazing prof.  I hated Calc after my high school class but Ram reinspired me.  The homework is a lot but after you come out of this class you are prepared wonderfully for any following math course.  From experience I can say you will have such an advantage in your future math classes.
professor ram made me not want to take math ever again. if you can switch, do it for your own sanity!

He gives out more homework than others so be prepared for some weeks of frusteration.  In my experience his midterms were a joke compared to his homework sets but I coulda gotten lucky.  I will try to avoid taking him again him my future.
So he made calculus interesting but not interesting enough to devote my entire life to homework.  I like the guy- atleast he is fun to chill with at the bars.
Everybody stop complaining about the homework!! It's honestly NOT that bad, especially if you have a brain and can understand the material. My favorite professor of all time. Really unique guy.

The homework involvd is simply not worth taking this class.  Don't expect to have a life if you plan to get all of the homework done.  I did get a B overall, but that was with out studying very much for the midterms.  I'm sure if you understand calc and do the hw u would be fine.

Well Simply not worth the work, Homework is 10+ hours a week and worth way to much, Got 2 A's and a C on midterm's but after final got a BC in class.  Do not take this class unless u have no life and love to stay in on weekends.

Very difficult.  The tests test time management and test-taking skills, not knowledge of the material.  Expect 15 hours of HW per week (due each week) in addition to test prep.  Good teacher during lecture.  Look forward to "Genesis" lecture.
No Comments
No Comments

This kid is kind of psycho, but he gets the job finished.  He's kind of ludicrous at times, and he expects you to be able to do math problems that he can't always do himself, but the expectations are definitely clear, and you can't complain about the tests being made verbatim from the homeworks.

If you want to learn calculus, and you're willing to work hard, Ram is a great professor. He does assign a bit too much homework, but his exam problems come straight from the homework. He's a bit of a kooky guy, but very personable. He's also entertaining when he lectures, in a strange way.

Do not take this professor.His teaching methods are not kool at all.His hwk is insane,his test do not show what you have really learned in the class. The concepts of calculus are all the same,but the problems he makes up are INSANE. to get an A it will  require you not to have a life.DO NOT TaKeHim

Change profesors immediately if you have Ram!  His method of teaching is confusing.  Ex: he refers to a function as a creature who eats things and spits out something else.  Save yourself!  Way too much homework.

I took calculus in high school, and I loved it.  However, taking math with Ram is a different story.  The homework is insane; I usually spend 15-20 hours a week on homework.  The exams are too short to show all that I've learned.  The hw is only 8% of my grade and I have to spend so much time on it!
Really unique, awesome teacher. I learn a lot from him.
DON'T TAKE HIM!!!I have so much homework it's not cool, and his exams are based on the homework so you must do it. BY the way, the homework takes a minimum of 15 hours per week.

First off Ram is a good guy!!! In terms of his homework... it sucks big time! If you took Calc in high school this class shouldn't be hard, but for people like me who didn't BE PREPARED TO WORK HARD!!! If you work hard you can "easily" manage an A or AB, GO TO office hours, GUTS, and math lab!! :(

i was warned about the amount of hw beforehand but i didn't realize it could be this unbearable.  you have to learn how to skip around.  tests are usually pretty tough(no time!) but there is a pretty decent curve.As long as you are in the top half of this class,you'll be fine. otherwise ram is fine

He's a nice guy and lectures are really clear. Gives awesome office hours-which usually half the lecture attends each week. LOTS OF HOMEWORK!Exams are tough and you don't get enough time. If you are starting 221 right out of High School and havn't been exposed to calc.-DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!

Prof Ram is a great professor.  There is a lot of homework each week, but if you use your time wisely during the week and you go to his office hours, you get a considerable amount done before Sunday night.  He explains things very well.  Overall great guy.
Gives a lotta homework!  Lots of really hard problems, but lots of easy ones too
Cool guy.  Somehow makes calc interesting. WAY too much homework, but you learn it. You need to write in complete sentences when you do homework

WAY TOO MUCH HOMEWORK.  He gives you enough homework to make you a loser in college.  It is almost impossible to understand evey problem on the homework.  Tests are straight fromt he homework problems but you have enough time to do maybe 3 problems.  GET A DIFFERENT PROF.
I love Ram
Ram rocks, but the homework sucks!
Hardest class I have ever taken. Did like 20-30 hrs of his homework a week on a good week.

Hardest class I have ever taken in my life.  My recommendation is to avoid his class at all costs because he gives enough homework to last the entire semester each week.  If you can get above a C in this class you must be God or a Calc. genius.
He tries hard for you, but if you don't understand homework, it is impossible to figure out, since he doesn't follow the book.  Nice guy, however unless you already know calculus stay away.

Avoid Ram... there are many instructors that assign MUCH less homework, but still give you a good calc understanding.  The homework isn't all that clear, you have to write out "in sentences" your answers to your homework.  Took me 20-40 hours/wk for homework.  Save yourself the trouble.
Here's one of those darn identities I learned:  GPA + (Ram's 221)= 2.0
He is a really great professor, if you want to learn calculus, take this class, the workload is a lot, but if you do it, the grade will come.  Be prepared, but I enjoyed him as a professor
Best Math prof.

Avoid this professor if you can!  The homework load is impossible (15-20 hours a week) and you need to do all of it to get a good grade.  His teaching style is odd (funny at times) and different than everyone else in the math department.  He gives more homework than he can explain in class.
Lots of homework, but a decent prof. He'll definetely prepare you for Math 212.

Ram assigns an intolerable work load, and you cannot do well in class without doing everything.  Get out of his class, and get out quickly.  Just because he's a neat person doesn't mean he should be teaching.  (And he is a really neat person).
He was very, very, very, hard.  Freshman beware you will have no life!!
There is no doubt that the guy will give you all the help you need.  That being said, be prepared for a TON of homework, both challenging and long.
Hard class and the homework load would bring Einstein to his knees.  However, assuming you survive the course you will have a solid understanding of beginning calculus.

Huge Ego. MIT educated and taught at Princeton.  Likes to repeatedly remind people of it too. Either his way or no way.  If you're decent at math and like to think in a logical manner, you're screwed.  Huge workload.  Just an overall poor professor.

Cool Prof!!!!!! Prof Ram is totally fun! 100 Math probs a week, curse him when u r in his class for making you slog but then its worth it n he'a a gr8 guy. If u take his class, ask him to play music on da last lec. He has a good ear for music!
The best math teacher i have ever had!!  You have to go to the class.  too much homework but doable.  He knows a lot and loves teaching.  He is the best teacher ever!!!
Work load too heavy and extremely difficult
there is way too much homework.  he's a fun guy and teaches clearly for the most part, but he doesn't follow the book so you can't go to it for help.  lectures were always interesting though.
very good professor, but not the easiest course.  i learned a lot from him though.
Easiest class I have ever taken!!

Total Overload of Homework! Hard also if you Haven't taken Calc b4 b/cuz you have nothing to fall back on when you can't follow his crazy ideas.  Fun and interesting lectures, cool guy but very hard class if you can't follow him. Had to drop it.
Different approach- helps a lot in future courses, though.
good job arun
Lots and lots of homework. Didn't teach some basic Calc principles. Don't take him if you don't want to do 15 hours of homework a week.
homework too much, difficult if taken calc before a little

Very cool professor, but insane amounts of homework.  He teaches in a really weird way that's great if you haven't taken calc before. It was anoying having to do 100 homework problems every week, but if you put in the time, you really learn it.

He is a very good teacher.  He breaks everything down to very simple terms.  He gives a lot of homework but you really understand what you are doing by the time you are done.  All of the test problems are taken directly off of the homework.
